root: ^"I glimpsed an unfamiliar rabbit hopping around the forest. I require a pure animal sacrifice for a potion"
^"I will, however what if the creature belongs to someone?"
^"I'm not able to help you right now."

mission: ^I questioned, a concern for the creature's origins flickering in my gaze.

^"Firmly, that doesn't bother me if it left its owner," Magnus asserted, his determination unwavering in the pursuit of magical ingredients. The mystical arts often demanded sacrifices, even if they came in the form of unsuspecting forest creatures."
^"Fetch the rabbit, my apprentice. Its sacrifice shall contribute to the alchemy that binds our magical world"
^Magnus instructed, his eyes reflecting a mixture of anticipation and dedication to the arcane arts.

^As I ventured into the mystical forest to capture the elusive rabbit, I couldn't shake the sense of responsibility for disrupting the creature's serene existence. The shadows of the trees whispered ancient secrets, and every rustle seemed to echo with a reminder of the delicate balance between nature and magic.
